PAGE.TITLE: Understanding correlation
PAGE.WELCOME: In the previous exercises we have dealt mostly with single random variables. What we want to assess in many branches of statistics, however, is what effect the value of one random variable, X, has on another different random variable, Y. In other words, we want to understand the degree to which the random variables X and Y are correlated. This exercise is meant to allow you to visualize what it means when we state that two variables are correlated and what it means when we state that two variables are correlated.
